JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.SmallTimeDelta.hi: Small time step UI button duration in minutes. This setting also defines the duration of a game exploration turn.
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.LargeTimeDelta.hi: Large time step UI button duration in hours
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.TimeChangeMacro.h: UUID of a macro that will be called when the time changes.
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.AutoTellTimeConfi: Controls whether the time of day is automatically posted to the game chat, and at what intervals.
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.DaylightCycleEnab: Enables or disables the daylight cycle globally. To disable the cycle on a single scene, enable the Lock Darkness Level setting on that scene.
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.AnimateDarknessCh: Duration in seconds of each change in lighting level during the transition from day to night and back again.
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.DaylightCycleSett: The Daylight Cycle controls changes in lighting as time changes from day to night and back again.
JDTIMEKEEPING.NoPermission: Easy Timekeeping: You do not have permission to call this function.
JDTIMEKEEPING.ResetTime.title: Confirm Time Reset
JDTIMEKEEPING.ResetTime.content: Reset the time to midnight of the first day?
JDTIMEKEEPING.SetTime.title: Set the Time
JDTIMEKEEPING.SetTime.label: Time
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.ShowDragonbaneTim: Show the Fuzzy Time in Game Turns and Shifts
If selected, this will be shown to players and the GM
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.ShowRadialClock.h: While they look like Global Progress Clocks, you can't click on them
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.UITextColor.name: UI Text Color
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.UITextColor.hint: Used for the time and fuzzy time strings
JDTIMEKEEPING.YouHaveNoIdeaOfTheTime: You have no idea what time it is
JDTIMEKEEPING.SmallIncrement: Move time forward by a small step
JDTIMEKEEPING.SmallDecrement: Move time backward by a small step
JDTIMEKEEPING.LargeIncrement: Move time forward by a large step
JDTIMEKEEPING.LargeDecrement: Move time backward by a large step
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.ShiftConfig.name: Daily Shift Settings
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.ShiftConfig.label: Daily Shift Settings
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.ShiftConfig.hint: Allows you to change the names of the four daily shifts
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.ShowPlayersExactT: The exact time is always shown to the GM and Assistant GM
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.UIFadeOpacity.hin: Controls the UI transparency when not in use. 0 is fully hidden, and 1 is fully visible.
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.ShowLongFormatTim: Show the Time in Long Format
Only has an effect when your GM has enabled exact time for players
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.WeekdayConfig.nam: Configure the Days of the Week
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.UIButtonHoveredCo: Time Step Button Color When Hovered
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.UIButtonClickedCo: Time Step Button Color When Clicked
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.GameTurnName.name: Game Turn
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.GameTurnName.hint: The name of a game or dungeon turn
JDTIMEKEEPING.showHideUI: Show or hide the User Interface
JDTIMEKEEPING.title: Easy Timekeeping
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.ShowUIInFloatingW: Show UI as a Floating Window
This lets you move the window around. If you close it, then the Show/Hide hotkey will bring it back again.
JDTIMEKEEPING.AVDockWarning: Foundry Audio/Video detected. Switching to the floating panel to avoid conflicts with the A/V interface.
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.RadialClockSpokeC: Used for the border and spokes
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.UIFocusOpacity.hi: Controls the UI transparency when in use. 0 is fully hidden, and 1 is fully visible.
JDTIMEKEEPING.Settings.UIBackgroundColor: Used on both the docked and floating panels
